pr_title: Use read lock when iterate tablet_map in TabletManager::start_trash_sweep

timeline.message: Use read lock when iterate tablet_map in TabletManager::start_trash_sweep

timeline.bodyText:
You can put tablet->delete_expired_inc_rowsets() between the ReadLock and WriteLock.
This is bottleneck which consumes much resource.
timeline.author: chaoyli

replies.bodyText:
Can you give the example code?
Is it  safe to iterate a map without read lock?
replies.author: liutang123

replies.bodyText:
Currently, there should be only one tablet in tablet_arr.
Only in the early Doris version, tablet_arr will appear multiple tablets.
And in tablet->delete_expired_inc_rowsets();, it will hold the meta lock, So no need to be protected by _tablet_map.
So you can just by doing:

do the tablets_to_clean.push_back(item.first); in ReadLock
Unlock the ReadLock, and iterate the tablets_to_clean to do the tablet->delete_expired_inc_rowsets();
Do the following tablet_map.erase(tablet_id_to_clean); in WriteLock
replies.author: morningman

replies.bodyText:
Unlock the ReadLock, and iterate the tablets_to_clean to do the tablet->delete_expired_inc_rowsets();
We should invoke delete_expired_inc_rowsets in all tablets but not only in tablets_to_clean. Isn't it?
replies.author: liutang123

timeline.message: Do delete_expired_inc_rowsets out of read lock.
